sections.markdown:
Did you know that full-time employees in the UK earned £528 per week on average in 2015, and that on average women earned 9.4% less than men per hour? These earnings varied greatly across the UK, with City of London employees earning the highest at £921 and employees in North East Derbyshire earning the lowest at £389.

There are plenty more interesting facts to explore by region, using our [cartogram][1] below to uncover stories of your own. You can even change the jobs sector and see how the shape of the country changes as a result.

<ons-interactive url="https://www.ons.gov.uk/visualisations/nesscontent/dvc126/ashemap.html" full-width="true" title="Annual Survey of Hours & Earnings - Map"/>



For more information, please contact: [earnings@ons.gov.uk][2]


  [1]: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cartogram
  [2]: mailto:earnings@ons.gov.uk

links.title: Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings, 2015 Provisional Results
How well does my job pay?

description.title: How do earnings vary across Great Britain?
